column4: hey there i am gettin an error my laptop is not booting. whenever i boot it gooes in a inbuilt shell called ash with (initramfs) prompt can anybody help
run "dmesg" and look for errors thta might cause it to not boot
the output of dmesg is one thing that I could check
just tell me some of the things that show up in it, specifically hard disk errors
it looks like that could cause it.  it might be bad ram
or something in the kernel or initrd image not working
there might be, but there also might not be a problem with that
I'm not exactly sure if that's the cause of the problem
did you recently make any changes to the system?
a software could also have caused this
anything in ubuntu, specifically installing, removing, or updating hardware
fsck might be able to fix it
use the livecd to run fsck
although on that cd it would be "sudo fsck" in a terminal
you might need a disk with the sata drivers on it.  Someone in the channel ##windows should know how to get windows and sata working
##windows is on this server.  Just type /join ##windows to get to it
